title: The Smugglers
dialogue_disasters: By the black albatross, I'll keelhaul ye from here to Port Royal!
goofs: William Hartnell in episode one: 'You see that scanner? That's what I call a scanner, up there!'
In episode two his reply to an invitation to 'talk like gentlemen' is 'Thank you, no.'
The rhyme quoted in episode three is different from the one he heard in episode one.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist of the series
continuity_notes.current_status: Has heard of the pirate Avery, knows a little Tarot, and feels a moral obligation to stay due to potential consequences of his actions

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.description: The Doctor's time and space travel machine
continuity_notes.current_status: Internal temperature drops suddenly on landing at the South Pole, possibly due to a circuit failure or as a warning

locations.name: Cornish village
locations.description: Setting of the episode in 17th century Cornwall
locations.current_status: Time period between 1603 and 1642, or 1660 and 1688, or 1694 onwards, with costumes suggesting the 1680s or 90s

additional_notes: The episode features 'tons of arrrhs' and mentions the pirate Morgan, who lived between 1635-1688.
bottom_line: A sweet little script. Hartnell is quite good, and by no means on his last legs. Pike is a great villain, and there's some fine period detail.
